result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of alcohol. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. Do not possess any firearms. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol. No contact with Palace Bar or Victim 1.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Chad C La Lor in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Todd Gerald Peterson appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Ellen Craker appears via video for a special appearance for the defendant. Court calls case. Defendant updates address. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $5,000 cash. No use or possession of alcohol. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol. Do not possess any firearms. No contact with Victim 1 or the Palace Bar. Recites short criminal history in MN with no FTA. Notes lack of ties to the area and seriousness of allegations. Attorney Craker asks for a signature bond and agrees with state on short criminal history and no FTA. Has employment and family and has resided at the same address in MN for 12 years. Defendant does not have anything he can post. Court notes the seriousness of the charges, safety of the public, and lack of local ties or contacts. Attorney Craker indicates that the defendant was in the area for work. Court orders $5,000 cash. No use or possession of alcohol. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon. Do not possess any firearms. No frequenting establishments who's primary purpose is to serve or sell alcohol. No contact with Palace Bar or Victim 1. Defendant does not qualify for the public defender's office. Court asks defendant about plan for retaining counsel. Defendant waives time limit for prelim to secure counsel. Court finds that the waiver was knowingly and intelligently made.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
